emerging_technologies.name: AI-driven Smart Contracts 2.0
emerging_technologies.description: Smart contracts that adapt in real-time to new conditions, laws, and market dynamics using advanced AI.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces human error and increases trust in automated systems, potentially reducing fraud and legal disputes.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires widespread acceptance of AI in legal systems, robust security protocols, and regulatory compliance.

emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized Space Operations Network (DeSpON)
emerging_technologies.description: A decentralized network for managing space missions, resource extraction, and settlements through blockchain governance.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Promotes transparency in space activities, potentially democratizing access to space resources.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Dependent on space law development, international cooperation, and technological maturity in space tech.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Identity Tokens
emerging_technologies.description: Tokens representing an individual's neural data, used for identity verification and secure transactions.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could revolutionize personal data privacy, security, and ownership, but raises ethical concerns about data exploitation.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption hinges on public trust in neural technology, robust security measures, and regulatory frameworks.

mainstream_technologies.name: Autonomous Transport Networks
mainstream_technologies.description: Fully autonomous vehicles integrated into a decentralized transport network, optimizing routes and traffic flow.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread in urban areas, reducing congestion and pollution, with high public acceptance due to proven safety records.

mainstream_technologies.name: Tokenized Energy Markets
mainstream_technologies.description: Energy generation and consumption are managed through blockchain, enabling peer-to-peer energy trading.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Standard in regions with high renewable energy penetration, supported by regulatory frameworks encouraging energy democratization.

epoch_themes.description: A shift towards decentralized systems in governance, finance, and infrastructure, reducing centralized control.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Fosters greater individual autonomy and potentially reduces corruption but requires new forms of oversight and accountability.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Global push towards democratic technologies, transparency in governance, and the empowerment of individuals through technology.

epoch_themes.description: The fusion of AI's decision-making capabilities with blockchain's security and decentralization.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Enhances system efficiency and security but might lead to new forms of AI bias or manipulation if not carefully managed.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased demand for secure, transparent, and autonomous systems in various sectors.
